page.title: 05MARYC.FARMING JOB GHILLIE
page.content: Mrs.Murdock,river ghillie's day starts between 4-5am during the fishing season:on the Dee that is 1st Feb.and 30th Sept.Although some anglers will have bought their permits the day before,it is possible she will,at that early hour have to issue permits.Cost is Â£10 a day,season ticket-Â£60.You may fish between 4am and 11pm except on Sundays.Mrs.Murdock patrols the beat,either on foot or by car,using binoculars 8 times a day,varying the times to deter would-be poachers. Mr.Fortescue,owner of the beat does not claim the catches but their number and weights are kept in a ledger. Besides salmon,finnock and sea trout are much sought after.The Powberry Pool is their favourite haunt.
